meanings.definition: An attractive combination of vitality and glamour.
meanings.sent1: The party decorations had a pizzaz touch with glitter and bright colors.
meanings.sent2: She always adds a pizzaz scarf to her outfit to stand out.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked so pizzaz with all the sparkles on top.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a pizzaz that lit up the room.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display was full of pizzaz, lighting up the night sky.

meanings.sent1: The team played with pizzaz and won the game.
meanings.sent2: Her dance performance was full of pizzaz and excitement.
meanings.sent3: The puppy ran around the yard with pizzaz, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were bustling with pizzaz during the festival.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice had a pizzaz that captivated the audience.

meanings.definition: A quality of excitement or appeal.
meanings.sent1: The movie lacked pizzaz and failed to impress the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her speech had a pizzaz that kept everyone engaged.
meanings.sent3: The carnival was full of pizzaz, with colorful lights and music.
meanings.sent4: The new restaurant added pizzaz to the neighborhood with its unique menu.
meanings.sent5: The fashion show was filled with pizzaz, showcasing the latest trends.
